feeds.source: The Record from Recorded Future News

items.title: Trump signs executive order on 'national framework' for AI regulation
items.summary: Seeking to end a "patchwork" of state-level AI regulation, the president spelled out his administration's approach to letting companies "be free to innovate."

items.title: Germany summons Russian ambassador over cyberattack, election disinformation
items.summary: Germany said it had "clear evidence" that a 2024 cyberattack on its air traffic control authority was the work of the Russian hacking operation known as APT28 or Fancy Bear.

items.title: New 'DroidLock' malware demands a ransom, locks user out of device
items.summary: Recently spotted malware targets Spanish-speaking Android users with a lock screen that demands a ransom and other changes that effectively render a device unusable, researchers say.

items.title: Federal agencies now only have one more day to patch React2Shell bug
items.summary: Wide exploitation of the vulnerability known as React2Shell has prompted CISA to reduce the amount of time federal agencies have to patch the bug.

items.title: Hackers reportedly breach developer involved with Russia’s military draft database
items.summary: A hacking group it had maintained access to the firm's systems for several months and had destroyed parts of the company’s infrastructure.

items.title: Announced pick for No. 2 at NSA won’t get the job as another candidate surfaces
items.summary: Joe Francescon, announced in August as the NSA's new deputy director, will not be filling the role, sources told Recorded Future News, and the Trump administration has another pick in mind.

items.title: UK fines LastPass £1.2 million for data breach affecting 1.6 million people
items.summary: The Information Commissioner’s Office said LastPass had “failed to implement sufficiently robust technical and security measures” to protect its data.

items.title: Federal agencies now only have one more day to patch React2Shell bug
items.summary: Wide exploitation of the vulnerability known as React2Shell has prompted CISA to reduce the amount of time federal agencies have to patch the bug.

items.title: Lawmaker calls facial recognition on doorbell cameras a ‘privacy nightmare’
items.summary: Sen. Ed Markey (D-MA) asked Ring in October about its privacy policies and how it intends to protect individuals recorded by its new facial recognition technology feature called Familiar Faces.
